dialogue: Not yet. Not even abroad. They won't admit it officially.
We have to talk to Lino. He'll know what to do.
There's nothing we can do now.
What do you mean? We have to force them to admit it publicly. A subpoena, a court order.
We believe we have to keep asking for his release, as if we didn't know what happened to him.
So my phone will keep on being tapped? To have someone parked outside my house all day long?
All I know is what I told you.
But what do you think happened? Tell me.
I've heard it all. Buried in the forest, dropped into the sea from a helicopter, mass graves. It's all rumors. There's no way to know, 'cause nobody will talk. They're afraid of disappearing, too.
Do you mind if I don't walk you out?
I'm sorry. I wish I were the bearer of better news.
